<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.02</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations and Financial Condition</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;22, 2015, Berkshire Hills Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), the holding company for Berkshire Bank (the &#147;Bank&#148;), announced its financial results for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2015.&#160; The news release containing the financial results is included as Exhibit&nbsp;99.1 and shall not be deemed &#147;filed&#148; for any purpose.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company conducted a conference call/webcast on July&nbsp;23, 2015 to discuss the financial results for the quarter. A telephone replay of the call will be available through Friday, July&nbsp;31, 2015. The webcast and a copy of management&#146;s script will be available on the Company&#146;s website for an extended period of time.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-1.0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 8.01</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Other Events</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;23, 2015, Firestone Financial Corp. (&#147;Firestone&#148;) received shareholder approval to merge Firestone with and into a subsidiary of the Bank. Accordingly, all regulatory and shareholder approvals have been obtained to complete the acquisition of Firestone as a subsidiary of the Bank. The merger is anticipated to close on or about August&nbsp;7, 2015.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9.01</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Financial Statements and Exhibits</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 87.75pt;text-indent:-18.75pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Financial Statements of Businesses Acquired.&#160; Not applicable.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 87.75pt;text-indent:-18.75pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pro Forma Financial Information.&#160; Not applicable.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 87.75pt;text-indent:-18.75pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shell Company Transactions.&#160; Not applicable.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 87.75pt;text-indent:-18.75pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Exhibits.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SIGNATURES</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, hereunto duly authorized.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.16%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="45%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:45.84%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Berkshire Hills Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc.</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

<html>
<head>




  </head>
<body link=blue lang="EN-US">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 99.1</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;"><img width="367" height="120" src="g161611mm01i001.gif"></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Berkshire Hills Reports 16% Increase in Second Quarter Core EPS; Dividend Declared</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">PITTSFIELD, MA, July&nbsp;22, 2015 &#151; Berkshire Hills Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. (NYSE: <b>BHLB</b>) reported $0.51 in core earnings per share in the second quarter of 2015, which was a 16% increase over second quarter results in the prior year.&#160; Profit growth reflects positive operating leverage from ongoing business development.&#160; Second quarter core EPS also increased at an 8% annualized rate compared to the prior quarter.&#160; GAAP EPS totaled $0.35 in the most recent quarter and reflected net non-core charges primarily related to the Hampden Bancorp acquisition, which was completed on April&nbsp;17.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SECOND QUARTER FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS </font></b><font style="border:none;">(comparisons are to prior quarter unless otherwise stated):</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">8% annualized increase in core earnings per share</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">13% increase in commercial loans (8% annualized organic)</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">13% increase in deposits (10% annualized organic)</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">14% increase in fee income</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">61.5% efficiency ratio</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">0.05% improvement in core ROA to 0.81% (0.56% GAAP ROA)</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">0.27% non-performing assets/assets</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 33.0pt;text-indent:-15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">0.27% net loan charge-offs/average loans</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">CEO Michael Daly stated, &#147;We had a good second quarter in organic business development across our regions and business lines.&#160; Commercial loan activity remained strong and deposits grew nicely after the slower winter quarter.&#160; Loan and deposit fee income also advanced and mortgage banking revenues remained elevated.&#148;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;I&#146;m proud of our recent achievements in building Berkshire&#146;s franchise.&#160; The acquisition of Hampden Bancorp was completed in April&nbsp;and was followed by a seamless systems conversion in June.&#160; We announced an agreement to acquire Firestone Financial, a commercial specialty lender in Eastern Massachusetts, and have moved expeditiously towards our goal of completing this attractive acquisition in August.&#148;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Daly concluded, &#147;The benefit of our positive operating leverage was demonstrated by improvement in our profitability and efficiency metrics in the second quarter.&#160; Our net interest margin continued to improve and is expected to benefit from the planned</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border:none;border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<td width="56%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:56.8%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">BHLB &#151; Berkshire Hills Bancorp</font></p>    </td>
<td width="43%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.2%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">www.berkshirebank.com</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">1<a name="PB_1_225413_7056"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\JMS\108183\15-16161-1\task7502070\16161-1-mm-01.htm',USER='108183',CD='Jul 23 23:00 2015' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Firestone acquisition in the third quarter.&#160; In addition to improving bottom line results, we introduced Apple Pay</font><font face="Arial" style="border:none;">&#153;</font><font style="border:none;"> convenience to our customers, and our employees participated in the biggest Week of Community Service in our Company&#146;s history.&nbsp;&#160; We continue to benefit from heightened recognition in our markets as a preferred partner, combining local focus with strong regional resources.&#148;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DIVIDEND DECLARED</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors voted to declare a cash dividend of $0.19 per share to shareholders of record at the close of business on August&nbsp;6, 2015, payable on August&nbsp;20, 2015.&#160; This dividend equates to a 2.7% annualized yield based on the $27.92 average closing price of Berkshire&#146;s common stock during the second quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FINANCIAL CONDITION</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Total assets increased by $948 million, or 14%, to $7.5 billion in the second quarter.&#160; This includes approximately $700 million added by the Hampden acquisition, which resulted in increases in most categories of assets and liabilities.&#160; Capital ratios improved and were enhanced by the equity issued for this acquisition.&#160; Liquidity ratios improved due to the strong deposit growth during the quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Total commercial loans increased at an 8% organic annualized rate in the second quarter.&#160; This growth reflected ongoing strong originations offset in part by targeted reductions in lower margin accounts.&#160; Total loans grew at a 5% annualized organic rate including mortgage growth less the impact of an ongoing repositioning of the auto loan portfolio.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Asset quality metrics remained favorable.&#160; Annualized net loan charge-offs measured 0.27% of average loans for the quarter.&#160;&#160; Quarter-end non-performing assets decreased to 0.27% of total assets and accruing delinquent loans decreased to 0.41% of total loans.&#160; The loan loss allowance measured 0.70% of total loans.&#160; Pursuant to accounting principles, no loan loss allowance was required for the $493 million in acquired Hampden loans, which were 9% of midyear loans.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Annualized organic deposit growth measured 10% in the second quarter, rebounding from slower growth in the winter quarter.&#160; This growth included targeted promotions of money market and time deposits, along with higher brokered balances.&#160; The ratio of loans/deposits was 99% at midyear, compared to 101% at the start of the year.&#160; Total borrowings increased due to acquired Hampden borrowings, as well as approximately $100 million in additional borrowings which were subsequently repaid from excess cash on July&nbsp;1, 2015.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Midyear tangible book value per share stood at $17.16, and was little changed from $17.19 at the start of the year despite the goodwill recorded for Hampden.&#160; Total book value per share measured $28.02 at midyear. The $9 million accumulated other comprehensive income outstanding at the beginning of the quarter was eliminated due to lower bond prices following the recent rise in long term interest rates.&#160; This noncash</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">2<a name="PB_2_225507_5335"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\108183\15-16161-1\task7502070\16161-1-mm-01.htm',USER='108183',CD='Jul 23 23:00 2015' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">unrealized change reduced book value per share by approximately $0.32 but had no impact on the Company&#146;s regulatory capital.&#160; The Company issued approximately 4.2 million net shares for the Hampden acquisition.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Most categories of revenue and expense increased in the most recent quarter including the impact of the added operations of Hampden Bancorp as of April&nbsp;17.&#160; Compared to the prior quarter, total core revenue increased by 16% and total core non-interest expense increased by 11%.&#160; The Hampden acquisition was not estimated to be accretive to core EPS until after most planned cost saves are achieved in the second half of the year.&#160; Including the benefit of the Hampden merger, profitability metrics improved, and Berkshire&#146;s core ROA and core ROE increased compared to the prior quarter and to the second quarter of 2014.&#160; The core return on tangible equity increased to 12.3%.&#160; The second quarter efficiency ratio was 61.5% which was also an improvement over the prior quarter and year over year.&#160; The Company recorded $0.16 per share in net non-core charges in the most recent quarter; these charges were primarily related to Hampden merger costs.&#160; GAAP EPS totaled $0.35 per share including the impact of these charges, and the GAAP ROE was 5.1%.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Net interest income increased by $7.1 million, or 16%, compared to the prior quarter.&#160; The net interest margin improved to 3.30% from 3.18% for these periods.&#160; Net interest income included $2.2 million in purchased loan accretion primarily from recoveries on the collection of credit impaired loans in prior bank acquisitions.&#160; Excluding purchased loan accretion, the margin improved to 3.16% in the most recent quarter compared to 3.15% in the prior quarter, including the benefit of higher loan yields and lower deposit costs.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Fee income increased quarter over quarter by $1.9 million, or 14%.&#160; Fee income included strong organic growth in loan related fees, including revenues on interest rate swaps and seasoned loan sale gains.&#160; Mortgage banking revenues remained elevated due to improved market conditions this year and deposit related fees increased from the slower winter quarter.&#160; Non-core securities gains totaled $2.4 million primarily due to the income recognized on Hampden shares previously owned by Berkshire.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">The loan loss provision totaled $4.2 million compared to $3.9 million in the prior quarter and exceeded net charge-offs in each of these quarters.&#160;&#160; Core non-interest expense totaled $45.3 million.&#160; At 2.52% of average assets, this ratio was little changed from the prior quarter.&#160; Core non-interest expense growth of $4.6 million included Hampden operating costs, along with higher costs related to the increase in impaired loan recoveries and loan related revenue.&#160; Expense growth also included additional investment in developing fee business lines to support future revenue growth.&#160; GAAP non-interest expense totaled $54.0 million in the second quarter compared to $45.1 million in the prior quarter, including $8.7 million and $4.4 million in non-core expenses in the two periods, respectively.&#160; Total full time equivalent staff increased by 6% to 1,153 including the Hampden team.&#160; With its combined strategies of revenue growth and expense</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">3<a name="PB_3_225524_5796"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\108183\15-16161-1\task7502070\16161-1-mm-01.htm',USER='108183',CD='Jul 23 23:00 2015' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">management, Berkshire operated with an improved efficiency ratio measuring 61.5% in the most recent quarter.&#160; The Company had 93 ongoing branches as of midyear and in 2015 has consolidated seven branches and entered an agreement to sell its Tennessee branch in the second half of the year.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Berkshire&#146;s income tax rate on core income was 17% in the most recent quarter, compared to 8% in the prior quarter.&#160; This includes the impact of the higher income from the Hampden operations, and the lower proportional benefit of tax-advantaged investments.&#160; Berkshire&#146;s tax rate on GAAP income was 10% in the most recent quarter and reflected the tax benefit related to non-core Hampden merger related charges.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONFERENCE CALL</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Berkshire will conduct a conference call/webcast at 10:00 a.m.&nbsp;eastern time on Thursday, July&nbsp;23, 2015 to discuss the results for the quarter and provide guidance about expected future results. Participants should dial-in to the call 10-15 minutes before it begins. Information about the conference call follows:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">BACKGROUND</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Berkshire Hills Bancorp is the parent of Berkshire Bank &#151; America&#146;s Most Exciting </font><font style="border:none;">Bank</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">&#174;</font><font style="border:none;">. Berkshire has $7.5 billion in assets and 93 ongoing full-service branch offices in Massachusetts, New York, Connecticut, and Vermont providing personal and business banking, insurance, and wealth management services.&#160; Berkshire has a pending agreement to acquire Firestone Financial Corp., a commercial specialty finance company with $190 million in assets, located in Needham, Massachusetts.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">This document contains forward-looking statements as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. There are several factors that could cause actual results to differ significantly from expectations described in the forward-looking statements. For a discussion of such factors, please see Berkshire&#146;s most recent reports on Forms 10-K and 10-Q filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and available on the SEC&#146;s website at www.sec.gov. Berkshire does not undertake any obligation to update forward-looking statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">4<a name="PB_4_225554_2897"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR STOCKHOLDERS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the proposed merger with Firestone Financial Corp., Berkshire has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-4 that includes a Proxy Statement of Firestone and a Prospectus of Berkshire, as well as other relevant documents concerning the proposed merger. Investors and stockholders are urged to read the Registration Statement and the Proxy Statement/Prospectus regarding the proposed merger and any other relevant documents filed with the SEC, as well as any amendments or supplements to those documents, because they will contain important information. A free copy of the Registration Statement and Proxy Statement/Prospectus, as well as other filings containing information about Berkshire and Firestone, when they become available, may be obtained at the SEC&#146;s Internet site (www.sec.gov). Copies of the Registration Statement and Proxy Statement/Prospectus and the filings that will be incorporated by reference therein may also be obtained, free of charge, from Berkshire&#146;s website at ir.berkshirebank.com or by contacting Berkshire Investor Relations at 413-236-3149.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PARTICIPANTS IN SOLICITATION</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Berkshire and Firestone and certain of their respective directors and executive officers may be deemed to be participants in the solicitation of proxies from the stockholders of Firestone in connection with the proposed merger. Information about the directors and executive officers of Berkshire is set forth in the proxy statement for Berkshire&#146;s 2015 annual meeting of stockholders, as filed with the SEC on the Schedule 14A on April&nbsp;1, 2015; in the Form&nbsp;8-K filed April&nbsp;28, 2015, and in the Form&nbsp;8-K filed on May&nbsp;7, 2015. Information about the directors and executive officers of Firestone is set forth in the Proxy Statement/Prospectus filed with the SEC by Berkshire on Form&nbsp;S-4/A on June&nbsp;29, 2015.&#160; Additional information regarding the interests of those participants and other persons who may be deemed participants in the transaction and a description of their direct and indirect interests, by security holdings or otherwise, may be obtained by reading other relevant documents regarding the proposed merger filed with the SEC, as they become available. Free copies of these documents may be obtained as described in the preceding paragraph.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">This document contains certain non-GAAP financial measures in addition to results presented in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;).&#160; These non-GAAP measures provide supplemental perspectives on operating results, performance trends, and financial condition.&#160; They are not a substitute for GAAP measures; they should be read and used in conjunction with the Company&#146;s GAAP financial information.&#160; A reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures to GAAP measures is included in the accompanying financial tables. &#160;In all cases, it should be understood that non-GAAP per share measures do not depict amounts that accrue directly to the benefit of shareholders.&#160; The Company utilizes the non-GAAP measure of core earnings in evaluating operating trends, including components for core revenue and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">5<a name="PB_5_225604_3020"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\108183\15-16161-1\task7502070\16161-1-mm-01.htm',USER='108183',CD='Jul 23 23:00 2015' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">expense.&#160; These measures exclude amounts which the Company views as unrelated to its normalized operations, including securities gains/losses, losses recorded for hedge terminations, merger costs, restructuring costs, systems conversion costs, and out-of-period adjustments.&#160; Non-core adjustments are presented net of an adjustment for income tax expense.&#160; This adjustment is determined as the difference between the GAAP tax rate and the effective tax rate applicable to core income.&#160; The efficiency ratio is adjusted for non-core revenue and expense items and for tax preference items.&#160; The Company also calculates measures related to tangible equity, which adjust equity (and assets where applicable) to exclude intangible assets due to the importance of these measures to the investment community.&#160; Charges related to merger and acquisition activity consist primarily of severance/benefit related expenses, contract termination costs, and professional fees.&#160; Systems conversion costs relate primarily to the Company&#146;s core systems conversion and related systems conversions costs.&#160;&#160; Restructuring costs primarily consist of costs and losses associated with the disposition of assets.&#160;&#160; In the most recent quarter, the Company reported organic growth of loans and deposits, which excluded the balances of accounts acquired in the Hampden acquisition.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONTACTS</font></b></p>

<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&nbsp;The Company acquired Hampden Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Hampden&#148;) on April&nbsp;17, 2015 with total assets of $0.7 billion.</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONSOLIDATED LOAN&nbsp;&amp; DEPOSIT ANALYSIS - UNAUDITED - (F-2)</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ASSET QUALITY ANALYSIS - UNAUDITED - (F-5)</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<td width="36%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:36.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">At&nbsp;or&nbsp;for&nbsp;the&nbsp;Quarters&nbsp;Ended</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="36%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:36.5%;">

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

<td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">June&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">

<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 17.3pt;text-indent:-17.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:8.5pt;">&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Reconciliation of Non-GAAP financial measures, including all references to core and tangible amounts, appear on pages&nbsp;F-9 and F-10.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">All performance ratios are annualized and are based on average balance sheet amounts, where applicable.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Tangible assets are total assets less total intangible assets.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">N/M means not meaningful.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-</font>6<a name="PB_6_230318_7107"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>

<td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.76%;">

<td width="96%" colspan="17" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:96.24%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Average balances for securities available-for-sale   are based on amortized cost.</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.76%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font></p>    </td>
<td width="96%" colspan="17" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:96.24%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Total average tangible equity results from   the subtraction of average goodwill and other intangible assets from total   average stockholders&#146; equity.</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.76%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font></p>    </td>
<td width="96%" colspan="17" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:96.24%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">The average balances of deposits include the   deposits held for sale presented under other liabilities on the consolidated   balance sheet.</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.76%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font></p>    </td>
<td width="96%" colspan="17" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:96.24%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">The average balances of loans include the   loans associated with the Tennessee branch sale presented under loans held   for sale on the consolidated balance sheet.</font></p>    </td>   </tr>

<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.1pt;text-indent:-10.1pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&nbsp;Cost of funds includes all deposits and borrowings.</font></p>

<td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.0%;">

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">887</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">859</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">852</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade align="left" style="color:black;"></div>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Total tangible stockholders&#146; equity is computed by taking total stockholders&#146; equity less the intangible assets at period-end.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Ratios are annualized and based on average balance sheet amounts, where applicable. Quarterly data may not sum to year-to-date data due to rounding.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Core return on tangible equity is computed by dividing the total core income adjusted for the tax-affected amortization of intangible assets, assuming a 40% marginal rate, by tangible equity.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">The tax benefit is the direct reduction to the income tax provision due to tax credits and deductions generated from investments in historic rehabilitation, low-income housing, new market projects, and renewable energy projects.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">The non-interest income charge is the reduction to the tax-advantaged investments, which are incurred as the tax credits are generated.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-</font>9<a name="PB_9_230732_988"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">5.03</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">3.00</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="55%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">Net   interest margin</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">3.24</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">3.31</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade align="left" style="color:black;"></div>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">The out of period adjustment shown above relates to interest income earned on loans acquired in bank acquisitions.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Total tangible stockholders&#146; equity is computed by taking total stockholders&#146; equity less the intangible assets at period-end.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Average diluted shares computed for core earnings per share differ from GAAP average diluted shares, in the first quarter of 2014, due to the GAAP net loss compared to core net income for the period.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Ratios are annualized and based on average balance sheet amounts, where applicable. Quarterly data may not sum to year-to-date data due to rounding.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">Core return on tangible equity is computed by dividing the total core income adjusted for the tax-affected amortization of intangible assets, assuming a 40% marginal rate, by tangible equity.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">The tax benefit is the direct reduction to the income tax provision due to tax credits and deductions generated from investments in historic rehabilitation, low-income housing, new market projects, and renewable energy projects.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" style="border:none;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="border:none;">The non-interest income charge is the reduction to the tax-advantaged investments, which are incurred as the tax credits are generated.</font></p>
<p style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="border:none;font-size:10.0pt;">F-</font><font style="border:none;">10</font><a name="PB_10_230718_9727"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
